title: Development of a Comparative Educational Philosophy Framework: Cognitive Phenomenological Psychology-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and foundational understanding of learning theories
context.additional_context: Development of an Educational Framework to Improve Mathematical Problem-Solving Abilities for Office/Administrative Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can compare major educational philosophies (behaviorism, constructivism, cognitivism) and explain the core principles of each philosophy.
Learners can design a framework connecting educational philosophies and teaching methodologies based on cognitive phenomenology.
Learners can select and apply appropriate instructional strategies for mathematics learning processes using the developed framework.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
